node.title: Peacock segmentation fault problem
node.bodyText:
When I try to run peacock (from peacock env), the following error is emerging: Segmentation fault (core dumped).
Paraview runs with no problems, libmesh is updated, chigger/tests/window/window_clear.py returns the same segmentation fault.
For some reason, I had some problems with environment variables (i.e. not set MOOSE_DIR).
test_PeacockMainWindow.py returns:


testConnections (__main__.Tests) ... QCssParser::parseColorValue: Specified color without alpha value but alpha given: 'rgb 111, 111, 111, 255'
QCssParser::parseColorValue: Specified color without alpha value but alpha given: 'rgb 180, 180, 180, 255'
QCssParser::parseColorValue: Specified color without alpha value but alpha given: 'rgb 111, 111, 111, 255'
QCssParser::parseColorValue: Specified color without alpha value but alpha given: 'rgb 111, 111, 111, 255'
QCssParser::parseColorValue: Specified color without alpha value but alpha given: 'rgb 180, 180, 180, 255'
QCssParser::parseColorValue: Specified color without alpha value but alpha given: 'rgb 111, 111, 111, 255'
No executable found for method type(s): opt, dbg, oprof, devel
QCssParser::parseColorValue: Specified color without alpha value but alpha given: 'rgb 111, 111, 111, 255'
QCssParser::parseColorValue: Specified color without alpha value but alpha given: 'rgb 180, 180, 180, 255'
QCssParser::parseColorValue: Specified color without alpha value but alpha given: 'rgb 111, 111, 111, 255'

QCssParser::parseColorValue: Specified color without alpha value but alpha given: 'rgb 180, 180, 180, 255'
QCssParser::parseColorValue: Specified color without alpha value but alpha given: 'rgb 111, 111, 111, 255'
WARNING
 '/home/balbest/Workmain/moose_projects/moose/test/moose_test-opt -options_left 0 --json' exited with non zero status 127.
Please make sure your application is built and able to execute the given arguments.
Working dir: /home/balbest/Workmain/moose_projects/moose/python/peacock/tests/peacock_app/PeacockMainWindow
Output: /home/balbest/Workmain/moose_projects/moose/test/moose_test-opt: error while loading shared libraries: libmoose-opt.so.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
WARNING
Failed to load json from '/home/balbest/Workmain/moose_projects/moose/test/moose_test-opt': '/home/balbest/Workmain/moose_projects/moose/test/moose_test-opt -options_left 0 --json' exited with non zero status 127.
Please make sure your application is built and able to execute the given arguments.
Working dir: /home/balbest/Workmain/moose_projects/moose/python/peacock/tests/peacock_app/PeacockMainWindow
Output: /home/balbest/Workmain/moose_projects/moose/test/moose_test-opt: error while loading shared libraries: libmoose-opt.so.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
FAIL
testConsole (main.Tests) ... QCssParser::parseColorValue: Specified color without alpha value but alpha given: 'rgb 111, 111, 111, 255'
QCssParser::parseColorValue: Specified color without alpha value but alpha given: 'rgb 180, 180, 180, 255'
QCssParser::parseColorValue: Specified color without alpha value but alpha given: 'rgb 111, 111, 111, 255'
QCssParser::parseColorValue: Specified color without alpha value but alpha given: 'rgb 111, 111, 111, 255'
QCssParser::parseColorValue: Specified color without alpha value but alpha given: 'rgb 180, 180, 180, 255'
QCssParser::parseColorValue: Specified color without alpha value but alpha given: 'rgb 111, 111, 111, 255'
No executable found for method type(s): opt, dbg, oprof, devel
ok
======================================================================
FAIL: testConnections (main.Tests)
Traceback (most recent call last):
File "/home/balbest/Workmain/moose_projects/moose/python/peacock/tests/peacock_app/PeacockMainWindow/./test_PeacockMainWindow.py", line 39, in testConnections
self.assertIn(path, w.windowTitle())
AssertionError: '/home/balbest/Workmain/moose_projects/moose/test/moose_test-opt' not found in 'Peacock'

Ran 2 tests in 0.486s
FAILED (failures=1)

 
moose_test-opt itself runs as usual

Hello
Which OS are you using?
Guillaume
Ubuntu 22
can you set the MOOSE_DIR environment variable, compile moose if you have not, and try again to see if those warnings about finding moose disappear ?

okay, after I repeated the process, I've got exactly the same output described here: #26884 (reply in thread)
And I also don't have any other VTK installations.
Repeating this #26884 (reply in thread)
returns the following:

(/home/balbest/home/balbest/Temp_conda/_env/.envs/peacock-testing) bash-5.1$ ./peacock
Traceback (most recent call last):
File "/home/balbest/Workmain/moose_projects/moose/python/peacock/./peacock", line 36, in 
run_peacock()
File "/home/balbest/Workmain/moose_projects/moose/python/peacock/./peacock", line 28, in run_peacock
sys.exit(main(sys.argv))
File "/home/balbest/Workmain/moose_projects/moose/python/peacock/./peacock", line 12, in main
from peacock.CheckRequirements import has_requirements
File "/home/balbest/Workmain/moose_projects/moose/python/peacock/init.py", line 11, in 
from . import base
File "/home/balbest/Workmain/moose_projects/moose/python/peacock/base/init.py", line 10, in 
from .MooseWidget import MooseWidget
File "/home/balbest/Workmain/moose_projects/moose/python/peacock/base/MooseWidget.py", line 11, in 
import mooseutils
File "/home/balbest/Workmain/moose_projects/moose/python/mooseutils/init.py", line 23, in 
from .civet_results import get_civet_results, get_civet_hashes
File "/home/balbest/Workmain/moose_projects/moose/python/mooseutils/civet_results.py", line 24, in 
DEFAULT_JOBS_CACHE = os.path.join(os.getenv('HOME'), '.local', 'share', 'civet', 'jobs')
File "/home/balbest/home/balbest/Temp_conda/_env/.envs/peacock-testing/lib/python3.10/posixpath.py", line 76, in join
a = os.fspath(a)
TypeError: expected str, bytes or os.PathLike object, not NoneType
can you export the HOME environment variable? It seems to fail on that line that does os.getenv('HOME')
yes, it was not defined. So now ./peacock returns "Aborted (core dumped)"

well nothing I can do from that unfortunately.
I would recommend:

try the workbench GUI instead : https://www.ornl.gov/onramp/neams-workbench
use the input files outside of the GUI and use paraview for visualizing meshes / results. That's how I do all my work
yes, I switch to paraview then, thanks for your efforts!

node.title: Issues with adaptivetimestep
node.bodyText:
Hi @GiudGiud ,
I am trying to compare my results with that obtain from ABAQUS, I got two issues:
I tired to solve the problem in MOOSE but it does not converge.
25 Nonlinear |R| = 8.920182e-05
Nonlinear solve did not converge due to DIVERGED_MAX_IT iterations 25
 Solve Did NOT Converge!
Currently Executing
  Finished Solving                                                                       [ 24.18 s] [  289 MB]
Aborting as solve did not converge

Solve failed, cutting timestep.



[Executioner]

  type = Transient
  solve_type = 'NEWTON'

  l_tol = 1e-10
  nl_max_its = 25
  nl_rel_tol = 1e-11
  nl_abs_tol = 1e-10
  l_max_its = 10

  petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type'
  petsc_options_value = 'lu'
 
  start_time = 0.0
  end_time = 118
 dtmax = 1.0

  [TimeStepper]
    type = IterationAdaptiveDT
    optimal_iterations = 20
    iteration_window = 9
    growth_factor = 2
    cutback_factor = 0.5
    dt = 0.01
  []

  line_search = 'none'
  automatic_scaling = true

[]

Follow the advice on this page for the non-convergence:
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/help/troubleshooting.html
For the time steps, you can now compose time steppers to create any time evolution you like (needs to converge though!)
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/syntax/Executioner/TimeStepper/index.html

Hi @GiudGiud,
I figured out the issue with the convergence, its related to the load.
See the loading figure, I tried changing the magnitude of load (P) with a constant. The real constant is 10.4 but I tried for 0.1 and 1 first.

The results matches for 0.1 but not for 1.0, with ABAQUS, is there any restriction of load that we can apply in MOOSE?

I dont think so
For 1.0, does MOOSE not converge?

Hi @GiudGiud, no its not converging.
25 Nonlinear |R| = 1.561106e-04
Nonlinear solve did not converge due to DIVERGED_MAX_IT iterations 25
 Solve Did NOT Converge!
Currently Executing
  Finished Solving                                                                       [ 24.10 s] [  278 MB]
Aborting as solve did not converge

Solve failed, cutting timestep.

[Executioner]

  type = Transient
  solve_type = 'NEWTON'

  l_tol = 1e-10
  nl_max_its = 25
  nl_rel_tol = 1e-11
  nl_abs_tol = 1e-10
  l_max_its = 10

  petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type'
  petsc_options_value = 'lu'
 
  start_time = 0.0
  end_time = 118
  dtmax = 1.0

  [TimeStepper]
    type = IterationAdaptiveDT
    growth_factor = 1.5
    cutback_factor = 0.5
    dt = 0.01
  []

  line_search = 'none'
  automatic_scaling = true

[]
can you attach the full log

hi @GiudGiud,
I tried again to check, it works till 0.2 X load but not beyond it.
Here it is :
*** ERROR ***
The following error occurred in the object "TimeStepper", of type "IterationAdaptiveDT".

Solve failed and timestep already at dtmin, cannot continue!

Stack frames: 11
0: 0   libmesh_opt.0.dylib                 0x0000000104a90264 libMesh::print_trace(std::__1::basic_ostream<char, std::__1::char_traits<char>>&) + 996
1: 1   libmoose-opt.0.dylib                0x0000000103fb3408 moose::internal::mooseErrorRaw(std::__1::basic_string<char, std::__1::char_traits<char>, std::__1::allocator<char>>, std::__1::basic_string<char, std::__1::char_traits<char>, std::__1::allocator<char>>) + 676
2: 2   libmoose-opt.0.dylib                0x0000000103f2fb54 callMooseErrorRaw(std::__1::basic_string<char, std::__1::char_traits<char>, std::__1::allocator<char>>&, MooseApp*) + 100
3: 3   libmoose-opt.0.dylib                0x00000001037ce080 void MooseObject::mooseError<char const (&) [61]>(char const (&) [61]) const + 328
4: 4   libmoose-opt.0.dylib                0x0000000103a9a1ec IterationAdaptiveDT::computeFailedDT() + 492
5: 5   libmoose-opt.0.dylib                0x0000000103aa3ccc TimeStepper::computeStep() + 152
6: 6   libmoose-opt.0.dylib                0x00000001033ef684 Transient::execute() + 120
7: 7   libmoose-opt.0.dylib                0x0000000103f8b0d8 MooseApp::executeExecutioner() + 268
8: 8   libmoose-opt.0.dylib                0x0000000103f8755c MooseApp::run() + 1468
9: 9   tensor_mechanics-opt                0x00000001006cbb40 main + 160
10: 10  dyld                                0x000000019dbe7f28 start + 2236
application called MPI_Abort(MPI_COMM_WORLD, 1) - process 0
[unset]: write_line error; fd=-1 buf=:cmd=abort exitcode=1
:
system msg for write_line failure : Bad file descriptor
(moose) sidharthsarmah@Sidharths-MacBook-Air tensor_mechanics %

no that's not it.  That s just the end of it
Please get the full log and attach (not paste because it s real long) here
docx is too unsafe for us :( could you please do .txt for the format

Here it is @GiudGiud
moose_error.txt
is something happening at time 82-83s ?
Hi @GiudGiud , No its just a continuous load that I applied for 118 s, but it does not occur, when load magnitude is increased.

Hi @GiudGiud,
I think this is the problem related with this problem.
I ran the problem till 22 s where there was no issue with convergence.
Till then the VonMises stress = 7200 MPa in 22 s, and the material Yield strength = 1220 MPa, it means there will be ample plastic deformation till 118s, but I defined the strain=small.

But when I use strain=finite, there is no convergence and this is very confusing to me, can you explain why I cannot use finite deformation because it falls in the plastic deformation.
[Modules/TensorMechanics/Master]

  [./all]
    strain = finite
    incremental = true
    add_variables = true
    use_automatic_differentiation = true
    save_in = 'force_x force_y'
  [../]

[]
@hugary1995

Hi @GiudGiud ,
I was able to solve it, please check it if it's correct, the load applied is very high and results in unrealistic deformation, but it can be solved. I have made this changes.
[GlobalParams]
  displacements = 'disp_x disp_y'
[]

[Modules/TensorMechanics/Master]
  [./all]
    strain = finite
    incremental = true
    add_variables = true
    use_automatic_differentiation = true
    save_in = 'force_x force_y'
  [../]
[]

[Executioner]
  type = Transient
  solve_type = 'PJFNK'
  petsc_options = '-snes_ksp_ew'
  petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type'
  petsc_options_value = 'lu'
  nl_abs_tol = 1e-10
  l_max_its = 20
  start_time = 0.0
  end_time = 118
  dtmax = 1.0
  [TimeStepper]
    type = IterationAdaptiveDT
    growth_factor = 1.5
    cutback_factor = 0.5
    dt = 0.1
  []
[]

To check if it s correct you should lead a mesh & time grid convergence study.
@recuero are these parameters good for this kind of loading tests?

@sidharthsarmah what parameters did you change to make it work?
For large deformation problems, PJFNK without AD or Newton with AD is recommended. If you switched from Newton to PJFNK, that may have helped obtain improved convergence.
@recuero , just changed NEWTON to PJFNK with AD, it still worked.
Yes, but it's probably more efficient with NEWTON.

hi @GiudGiud ,
Instead of make -j 4 for building, I typed make -j 5 by mistake, now I am getting this error, please suggest.
*** ERROR ***
A 'ADCZMRealVectorScalar' is not a registered object.

If you are trying to find this object in a dynamically linked library, make sure that
the library can be found either in your "Problem/library_path" parameter or in the
MOOSE_LIBRARY_PATH environment variable.
I realize today that the ADCZMRealVectorScalar is not present in the MOOSE code, is this not ready? @hugary1995 @GiudGiud , thanks!
What's the context? Is this in a PR already?

Hi @GiudGiud , I want a time step which is 1000 s for time 86400 s, and 0.35 s after it reaches 86400, something like this:

[./dts]
    type = PiecewiseLinear
    x = '0   86400 86638'
    y = '1000 0.35 0.35'
  [../]

[Executioner]

  type = Transient

  solve_type = 'NEWTON'
  line_search = none

  petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type'
  petsc_options_value = 'lu'

  automatic_scaling = true
  l_tol = 1e-10
  nl_rel_tol = 1e-10
  nl_abs_tol = 1e-10
  nl_max_its = 10
  start_time = 0.0
  end_time = 86638
  dtmax = 1000
  [./TimeStepper]
    type = FunctionDT
    function = dts
  [../]
[]

node.title: Convergence problem for porous_flow
node.bodyText:
Greetings,
I am encountering convergence challenges in a seemingly straightforward porous flow problem. The solver throws either a 'Nonlinear solve did not converge due to DIVERGED_LINE_SEARCH' or a 'Nonlinear solve did not converge due to DIVERGED_MAX_IT iterations 50' error.
Has anyone encountered and successfully resolved this issue before? I would greatly appreciate any insights or solutions you can offer.
Thank you,
Following is my code and inside injection.bh is '1 0 0 0'.
_injection_rate = -0.10 # kg/s/m, negative because injection as a source

[Mesh]
  [gen]
    type = GeneratedMeshGenerator
    dim = 2
    nx = 14 
    ny = 8  
    xmin = -35
    xmax = 35
    ymin = -20
    ymax = 20
  []
  [injection_node]
    input = gen
    type = ExtraNodesetGenerator
    new_boundary = injection_node
    coord = '0 0 0'
  []
[]

[GlobalParams]
  PorousFlowDictator = dictator
  gravity = '0 0 0'
[]

[Variables]
  [f_Al]
    initial_condition = 3.07E-08
  []
  [f_Ca]
    initial_condition = 1.98E-06
  []
  [f_Cl]
    initial_condition = 2.26E-04
  []
  [f_Fe]
    initial_condition = 1.98E-07
  []
  [f_H]
    initial_condition = 2.53E-04
  []
  [f_K]
    initial_condition = 1.02E-05
  []
  [f_Mg]
    initial_condition = 9.87E-08
  []
  [f_Na]
    initial_condition = 2.43E-04
  []
  [f_O2]
    initial_condition = 1.74E-05
  []
  [f_SiO2]
    initial_condition = 1.01E-05
  []
  [f_HCO3]
    initial_condition = 1.56E-02
  []
  [f_SO4]
    initial_condition = 1.8983E-10
  [] 
  [porepressure]
    initial_condition = 1E6
  []
  [temperature]
    initial_condition = 40
    scaling = 1E-6 # fluid enthalpy is roughly 1E6
  []
[]

[BCs]
  [injection_temperature]
    type = MatchedValueBC
    variable = temperature
    v = injection_temperature
    boundary = injection_node
  []
[]

[DiracKernels]
  [inject_H2O]
    type = PorousFlowPolyLineSink
    SumQuantityUO = injected_mass
    fluxes = ${injection_rate}
    p_or_t_vals = 0.0
    line_length = 1.0
    multiplying_var = injection_rate_massfrac_H2O
    point_file = injection.bh
    variable = porepressure
  []
  [inject_H]
    type = PorousFlowPolyLineSink
    SumQuantityUO = injected_mass
    fluxes = ${injection_rate}
    p_or_t_vals = 0.0
    line_length = 1.0
    multiplying_var = injection_rate_massfrac_H
    point_file = injection.bh
    variable = f_H
  []
  [inject_Cl]
    type = PorousFlowPolyLineSink
    SumQuantityUO = injected_mass
    fluxes = ${injection_rate}
    p_or_t_vals = 0.0
    line_length = 1.0
    multiplying_var = injection_rate_massfrac_Cl
    point_file = injection.bh
    variable = f_Cl
  []
  [inject_Na]
    type = PorousFlowPolyLineSink
    SumQuantityUO = injected_mass
    fluxes = ${injection_rate}
    p_or_t_vals = 0.0
    line_length = 1.0
    multiplying_var = injection_rate_massfrac_Na
    point_file = injection.bh
    variable = f_Na
  []
  [inject_SO4]
    type = PorousFlowPolyLineSink
    SumQuantityUO = injected_mass
    fluxes = ${injection_rate}
    p_or_t_vals = 0.0
    multiplying_var = injection_rate_massfrac_SO4
    point_file = injection.bh
    variable = f_SO4
  []
  [inject_Mg]
    type = PorousFlowPolyLineSink
    SumQuantityUO = injected_mass
    fluxes = ${injection_rate}
    p_or_t_vals = 0.0
    line_length = 1.0
    multiplying_var = injection_rate_massfrac_Mg
    point_file = injection.bh
    variable = f_Mg
  []
  [inject_Ca]
    type = PorousFlowPolyLineSink
    SumQuantityUO = injected_mass
    fluxes = ${injection_rate}
    p_or_t_vals = 0.0
    line_length = 1.0
    multiplying_var = injection_rate_massfrac_Ca
    point_file = injection.bh
    variable = f_Ca
  []
  [inject_K]
    type = PorousFlowPolyLineSink
    SumQuantityUO = injected_mass
    fluxes = ${injection_rate}
    p_or_t_vals = 0.0
    line_length = 1.0
    multiplying_var = injection_rate_massfrac_K
    point_file = injection.bh
    variable = f_K
  []
  [inject_HCO3]
    type = PorousFlowPolyLineSink
    SumQuantityUO = injected_mass
    fluxes = ${injection_rate}
    p_or_t_vals = 0.0
    line_length = 1.0
    multiplying_var = injection_rate_massfrac_HCO3
    point_file = injection.bh
    variable = f_HCO3
  []
  [inject_SiO2]
    type = PorousFlowPolyLineSink
    SumQuantityUO = injected_mass
    fluxes = ${injection_rate}
    p_or_t_vals = 0.0
    line_length = 1.0
    multiplying_var = injection_rate_massfrac_SiO2aq
    point_file = injection.bh
    variable = f_SiO2
  []

  [inject_Al]
    type = PorousFlowPolyLineSink
    SumQuantityUO = injected_mass
    fluxes = ${injection_rate}
    p_or_t_vals = 0.0
    line_length = 1.0
    multiplying_var = injection_rate_massfrac_Al
    point_file = injection.bh
    variable = f_Al
  []
  [inject_Fe]
    type = PorousFlowPolyLineSink
    SumQuantityUO = injected_mass
    fluxes = ${injection_rate}
    p_or_t_vals = 0.0
    line_length = 1.0
    multiplying_var = injection_rate_massfrac_Fe
    point_file = injection.bh
    variable = f_Fe
  []
  [inject_O2]
    type = PorousFlowPolyLineSink
    SumQuantityUO = injected_mass
    fluxes = ${injection_rate}
    p_or_t_vals = 0.0
    line_length = 1.0
    multiplying_var = injection_rate_massfrac_O2aq
    point_file = injection.bh
    variable = f_O2
  [] 

  
[]

[UserObjects]
  [injected_mass]
    type = PorousFlowSumQuantity
  []
  
[]

[Postprocessors]
  [dt]
    type = TimestepSize
    execute_on =  'timestep_begin'
  []
  [tot_kg_injected_this_timestep]
    type = PorousFlowPlotQuantity
    uo = injected_mass
  []
  
[]


[FluidProperties]
  [the_simple_fluid]
    type = SimpleFluidProperties
    thermal_expansion = 0
    bulk_modulus = 2E9
    viscosity = 1E-3
    density0 = 1000
    cv = 4000.0
    cp = 4000.0
  []
[]

[PorousFlowFullySaturated]
  coupling_type = ThermoHydro
  porepressure = porepressure
  temperature = temperature
  mass_fraction_vars =     'f_Al    f_Ca    f_Cl    f_Fe    f_H    f_K    f_Mg    f_Na    f_O2    f_SiO2    f_SO4     f_HCO3'
  save_component_rate_in = 'rate_Al rate_Ca rate_Cl rate_Fe rate_H rate_K rate_Mg rate_Na rate_O2 rate_SiO2 rate_SO4 rate_HCO3 rate_H2O' # change in kg at every node / dt
  fp = the_simple_fluid
  temperature_unit = Celsius
  pressure_unit = Pa 
[]

[AuxVariables]
  [injection_temperature]
    initial_condition = 30
  []
  [injection_rate_massfrac_H2O]
    initial_condition =0.963547651
  []
  [injection_rate_massfrac_H]
    initial_condition =2.29484E-05
  []
  [injection_rate_massfrac_Cl]
    initial_condition = 0.019342814
  []
  [injection_rate_massfrac_Na]
  initial_condition = 0.010748178
  []
  [injection_rate_massfrac_SO4]
  initial_condition = 0.002703787
  []
  [injection_rate_massfrac_Mg]
  initial_condition = 0.001288594
  []
  [injection_rate_massfrac_Ca]
  initial_condition = 0.000409535
  []
  [injection_rate_massfrac_K]
    initial_condition = 0.000399504
  []
  [injection_rate_massfrac_HCO3]
    initial_condition = 0.001531021
  []
  [injection_rate_massfrac_SiO2aq]
    initial_condition = 5.96563E-06
  [] 
  [injection_rate_massfrac_Al]
    initial_condition = 2.6009E-10
  [] 
  [injection_rate_massfrac_Fe]
    initial_condition = 5.38341E-10
  [] 
  [injection_rate_massfrac_O2aq]
    initial_condition = 3.08455E-10
  [] 
  [rate_Al]
  []
  [rate_Ca]
  []
  [rate_Cl]
  []
  [rate_Fe]
  []
  [rate_H]
  []
  [rate_HCO3]
  []
  [rate_K]
  []
  [rate_Mg]
  []
  [rate_Na]
  [] 
  [rate_O2]
  []
  [rate_SiO2]
  []
  [rate_SO4]
  []
  [rate_H2O]
  []
[]

[Materials]
  [porosity]
    type = PorousFlowPorosityConst # this simulation has no porosity changes from dissolution
    porosity = 0.2
  []
  [permeability]
    type = PorousFlowPermeabilityConst
    permeability = '1E-10 0 0   0 1E-10 0   0 0 1E-10'
  []
  [thermal_conductivity]
    type = PorousFlowThermalConductivityIdeal
    dry_thermal_conductivity = '2.3 0 0  0 2.3 0  0 0 2.3'
  []
  [rock_heat]
    type = PorousFlowMatrixInternalEnergy
    density = 2900.0
    specific_heat_capacity = 950.0
  []
[]

[Preconditioning]
  active = typically_efficient
  [typically_efficient]
    type = SMP
    full = true
    petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type -pc_hypre_type'
    petsc_options_value = ' hypre    boomeramg'
  []
  [strong]
    type = SMP
    full = true
    petsc_options = '-ksp_diagonal_scale -ksp_diagonal_scale_fix'
    petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type -sub_pc_type -sub_pc_factor_shift_type -pc_asm_overlap'
    petsc_options_value = ' asm      ilu           NONZERO                   2'
  []
  [probably_too_strong]
    type = SMP
    full = true
    petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type -pc_factor_mat_solver_package'
    petsc_options_value = ' lu       mumps'
  []
[]

[Executioner]
  type = Transient
  solve_type = Newton
  end_time = 7.76E6 # 90 days
  dt = 1E5
[]

[Outputs]
  exodus = true
  csv=true
[]_

Hello
There are troubleshooting instructions for moose in general here
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/moose/application_usage/failed_solves.html
and some instructions to try for porous flow here
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/modules/porous_flow/tutorial_02.html
Guillaume
You don't have gravity and no fluid boundary conditions. So the simulation won't converge to any result.

Hi,
Thank you for your reply. This is a injection problem and  the BC is set up by using [DiracKernels]. The above example is based on the folder ' projects/moose/modules/combined/examples/geochem-porous_flow/geotes_2D'

I'm aware that it should work. But defining a boundary condition makes the convergence much easier.
Does the example file run standalone without MultiApp coupling to the Geochemistry module (as in the original examples)?
Unfortunately, the PorousFlow-Geochemical examples are not straightforward and easy to reproduce. Your non-convergence looks to me like non-physical values in any of the input files.
I guess more experts on the PorousFlow-Geochemistry module can help more than me.

Yes, the example can run standalone by commenting the MultiApp of geochemistry coupling.
I will double check the input file. Many thanks.
I'll try and take a look today

Well, the pressure blows up as you are injecting mass but not allowing any to leave with a BC, but I think that the default tolerance is too tight which is the main issue. Try setting something looser like 'nl_rel_tol = 1e-6' or 'nl_abs_tol = 1e-8' etc
This problem has been solved after adding producer and tolerance. Dear Chris Green @cpgr , Appreciate your quick and professional guidance.

node.title: Image Function Mesh Refinement Error when using with NS Module
node.bodyText:
I am looking for some advice on some strange errors I am getting attempting  to use Moose's NS module to predict flow through voids from a 2 phase microCT image.  Many thanks!
I first use ImageFunction with a GradientJumpIndicator to create an adaptively refined mesh which I separate into two blocks using the approach suggested in this discussion: #26733.
I then read in the refined mesh, remove the block corresponding to the solid-phase, and perform a NS analysis with unit pressure gradient (1 on the left face and zero on the right). The results of the analysis are shown below. It looks like the pressure is only being carried along certain paths were the elements are all equivalent sizes.

and here are results with no adaptive mesh refinement, just uniform refinement,
.
In addition, I had to play around with solver settings. Using the standard bjacobi preconditioner resulted in the following error which I resolved by using an asm precon. with an lu sub_pc following this page (https://mooseframework.inl.gov/modules/porous_flow/solvers.html)

  Linear solve did not converge due to DIVERGED_PC_FAILED iterations 0
                 PC failed due to SUBPC_ERROR

Step 1: Adaptive Refinement Script
[Mesh]
  [gen]
        type = GeneratedMeshGenerator
        dim = 2
        nx = 25 # = number of image pixels in x
        ny = 25 # = number of image pixels in y
    []
  [block0]
    type = SubdomainBoundingBoxGenerator
    input = 'gen'
    block_id = 0
    bottom_left = '0 0 0'
    top_right = '1 0.5 0'
  []
  [block1]
    type = SubdomainBoundingBoxGenerator
    input = 'block0'
    block_id = 1
    bottom_left = '0 0.5 0'
    top_right = '1 1 0'
  []
[]

[Functions]
    [image_func]
      type = ImageFunction
      file_base = test_images/Random_Sphers_25x_
      file_suffix = png
      file_range = '1'
      threshold = 1
      upper_value = 1
      lower_value = 0
    []
[]
  
[AuxVariables]
  [auxBlockID]
  []
[]

[AuxKernels]
  [aux_kern]
    type = FunctionAux
    variable = auxBlockID
    function = image_func
    execute_on = 'INITIAL'
  []
[]

[UserObjects]
  [change_blockID]
    type = CoupledVarThresholdElementSubdomainModifier
    coupled_var = auxBlockID
    criterion_type = ABOVE
    threshold = 0
    subdomain_id = 1
    complement_subdomain_id = 0
    execute_on = 'INITIAL'
  []
[]


[Variables]
    [u]
    []
[]

#Try use the auxillary variable in the adaptivity criterion instead of assigning it to the displacement variable
[ICs]
    [u_ic]
      type = FunctionIC
      function = image_func
      variable = u
    []
[]
  
[Problem]
    type = FEProblem
    solve = false  # that was the other way no to solve the problem, but only generate the mesh
[]
  
[Executioner]
    type = Transient
    num_steps = 1
    dt = 0.1
[]
  
[Adaptivity]
    max_h_level = 2
    initial_steps = 2
    initial_marker = marker
    [Indicators]
      [indicator]
        type = GradientJumpIndicator
        variable = u
      []
    []
    [Markers]
      [marker]
        type = ErrorFractionMarker
        indicator = indicator
        refine = 0.9
      []
    []
[]
  
[Outputs]
    exodus = true
[]

Step 2: NS Solution Script
mu = 1.1
rho = 1

[Mesh]

    [adapt]
        type = FileMeshGenerator
        file =adapt_mesh_creation_out.e
    []

    [ed0]
        type = BlockDeletionGenerator
        input = adapt
        block = '1'
        new_boundary ='void_surface'
    []



[]

[Modules]
  [NavierStokesFV]
    compressibility = 'incompressible'
    porous_medium_treatment = true

    density = 'rho'
    dynamic_viscosity = 'mu'
    porosity = 'funcporosity'

    initial_velocity = '1e-6 1e-6 0'
    initial_pressure = 0.0

    inlet_boundaries = 'left'
    momentum_inlet_types = 'fixed-pressure'
    momentum_inlet_function = '1'
    outlet_boundaries = 'right'
    momentum_outlet_types = 'fixed-pressure'
    pressure_function = '0'

    wall_boundaries = 'top bottom void_surface '
    momentum_wall_types = 'noslip noslip noslip'
    

    friction_types = 'darcy '
    friction_coeffs = 'Darcy_coefficient'

    mass_advection_interpolation = 'average'
    momentum_advection_interpolation = 'average'
  []
[]

[FunctorMaterials]
  [const]
    type = GenericFunctorMaterial
    prop_names = 'rho mu'
    prop_values = '${rho} ${mu}'
    outputs = exodus
  []
  [friction]
    type = GenericVectorFunctorMaterial
    prop_names = 'Darcy_coefficient '
    prop_values = '0.1 0.1 0.1'
    outputs = exodus
  []

  [jump]
    type = PiecewiseByBlockFunctorMaterial
    prop_name = 'funcporosity'
    subdomain_to_prop_value = '0 0.1
                               1 0.1'
    outputs = exodus
  []

[]



[Executioner]
    type = Transient
    dt = 1.0
    solve_type = 'PJFNK'
    steady_state_detection = true
    steady_state_tolerance = 1E-8
    petsc_options_iname = ' -pc_type -pc_asm_overlap  -sub_pc_type -sub_pc_factor_shift_type -ksp_type  '
    petsc_options_value = 'asm 2 lu NONZERO gmres'
    nl_rel_tol = 1e-11
    nl_abs_tol = 1e-14
  []
  
  
  [Outputs]
    exodus = true
    print_linear_residuals = true 
    print_nonlinear_residuals = true
    #print_perf_log = true 
  
  []

Random_Spheres_25x_01.png:

I then read in the refined mesh
file =adapt_mesh_creation_out.e

we cant read exodus files with adaptivity refinement patterns. You ll have to use the Checkpoint format (for both writing in the first simulation and reading in the second) so that we read it properly
if you used a MeshDiagnosticsGenerator on your final mesh you would see it was read with tons of non-conformalities.

Thanks Guillaume! Is there an example of this beyond what's available here: https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/outputs/Checkpoint.html
Also is there a way I can do this all in one script that I am just not understanding?

It's just writing then reading. You can look at test/tests/checkpoint, maybe there's an example there?
To restart the variables from a checkpoint, use the parameters in the problem (restart_file_base notably)
But yes you are right. You could do this in one step. Just use a step of 'initial' adaptivity instead of regular adaptivity.
The parameters for initial adaptivity are specified in the same block

node.bodyText:
I got the following error when run update_and_rebuild_libmesh.sh:  DEBUG and NDEBUG should never be defined simultaneously.
I don't know if it's relevant, but I also unset LIBMESH_DIR to start the update beforehand

Do you have METHODS set in your environment?
Can you run the diagnostics.sh script in the same directory, and report those results:
cd moose/scripts
./diagnostics.sh

did you change the CPPFLAGS environment variable to include this flag? or maybe something in your environment did.
CPPFLAGS=-DNDEBUG

we would add -DDEBUG when building the debug version, which creates the problem
maybe let's edit this DNDEBUG away from CPPFLAGS

Because you have the top most level package moose-dev installed, there is no need to build libMesh manually. The moose-dev Conda package will provide all the necessary libraries.
If you are wanting to build libMesh yourself we should create a separate environment specially tailored to do so. That way you don't have to worry about setting or un-setting LIBMESH_DIR, etc.
Of course, this is neither here nor there for the error you are receiving... Just my observations!

Thank you GuidGuid and milljm! The reason I did it is the problem with peacock, and this was one of the solutions I found on forums. It didn't help, as one could expect. So I'll create another topic about this.
I didn't change CPPFLAGS intentionally. Moreover, the installations of both conda and moose are absolutely fresh.

node.title: Beam functions for beam or beam elements?
node.bodyText: Are the utility functions for the Timoshenko beam like InertialForceBeam for the entire beam or a beam element? For example, if I use a 1D mesh with nx=10, do I need to provide Iy and Iz for the entire beam or for just 1/10nth of the beam for InertialForceBeam?
@cbolisetti
They're block restricted. So if you enter a function that varies Ix, Iy in space, it will be used for the elements in the whole block. The block can have any number of elements you want.

@cbolisetti Thank you for your answer. To be honest though, I din't quite understand what you mean. Suppose I create a mesh using
[Mesh]
  [mesh]
    type = GeneratedMeshGenerator
    dim = 1
    nx = 10
    xmin = 0.0 # [m]
    xmax = 1.6 # [m]
  []
[]

and I want to model a beam of length 1.6m. Just so that we use the some notation. This beam would have 10 elements, correct? This beam has just one Ix, one Iy and one Iz. Each element (having the same length 0.16m), would have its own set of values Ix,Iy,Iz. What do the values Iy,Iz that I pass to InertialForceBeam refer to?
Somehow I would assume that if I pass just one value (Iy = 7.33653e-8), it applies it to all of them? However, there is no error when I pass two values ('7.33653e-8 6.33653e-8'), which doesn't make any sense. So, I am quite confused how this all adds up.
Your help would be much appreciated.

Looks like I misunderstood your question. If you use one number in this case, it will be applied to all 10 elements. In this case you only have one block, which is the default. I think if you enter multiple values they will be applied to multiple blocks. I am not sure why there's no error thrown in this case..probably an oversight.

@cbolisetti thank you again for your answer. So to conclude this. If I use a single value for Iy, for example. Does that value refer to the Iy for one element out of the ten (in the above example) or for the entire beam?
In your case, that should apply for the entire beam.

node.title: Have MOOSE output files outside of moose project folder
node.bodyText:
I am trying to output outside of my project folder named Tarpon. I am trying to output to a folder I use for some MATLAB post-processing; however, moose will not identify the home path. Instead of going to:
Home/Main/Data
MOOSE creates a new file path inside itself:
Home/projects/tarpon/Home/Main/Data
How can I make moose output outside of itself? There is not much documentation on file_base
[Outputs]
file_base = Home/Main/Data/3d2
[./exodus]
type = Exodus
interval = 1
#sync_times = '1000 1200'
file_base = Home/Main/Data/3d2
[../]
csv = true
checkpoint = true
[]

Hello
You can either use ../../ etc to get out of the folder where the input is run.
Or you can try an absolute path ~/Home/Main/Data
Either should be supported though I have only tested the former
Guillaume

Thank you. Using "../../" worked perfectly.
I tried using the absolute path first, but it kept just making a folder named "~".

node.title: The interface protocol
node.bodyText:
Hello, I would like to package my program into the MOOSE framework. How can I find the interface protocol information of MOOSE and integrate it into MOOSE in a standardized manner? I have not found any relevant instructions on the official website yet.
yours,
lvkas

Hello
The recommended way is to create an ExternalProblem class and set up the execution logic for your external program there.
You can look to cardinal as an example of executing external programs within MOOSE
https://github.com/neams-th-coe/cardinal
Guillaume

node.title: BreakMeshByBlockGenerator interface
node.bodyText: Hello, what exactly differs when using the add_interface_on_two_sides = true, shouldn't it be giving the same results overall?

Hello
The sideset is being added on both sides of the cut
As opposed to being only on one side
It's usually more a matter of needing the two sidesets for some model that relies on both, for example a contact model.
If you only have one side, then you cant use the model
Guillaume

node.title: Multiphase Multicomponent Microstructure Simulation
node.bodyText:
Hello Moose Community,
I hope you all are doing great.  I am here with a request to help me simulate the microstructure of a Multicomponent Multiphase alloy system using Moose at different heat treatment conditions. I am very new to phase field simulation and also to Moose. Request you to kindly help me in this regard.
I have experience in CALPHAD simulation.
Thanks for your time.
@amjokisaari @laagesen

Hello and thanks for your interest in the MOOSE framework! Where are you located? If you are able to attend the upcoming MOOSE training workshop this summer, that would help you get up to speed quickly:
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/training/index.html
